intro: Pilosella akinfiewii, commonly known as the Siberian mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of Siberia and northern Russia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are hairy and spoon-shaped, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Pilosella akinfiewii is often found in open habitats such as tundra and mountain meadows.
